Title: Update your .bash_profile PATH
Description:
Go to your home directory. cd ~
Edit the .bash_profile file and add the following line:
export PATH=$PATH:/Applications/Postgres.app/Contents/Versions/9.3/bin

Now you should be able to open the psql terminal from the command line using $ psql.

Title: create a new psql database
Description:
open 'psql' and type the command:
CREATE DATABASE exercisedb;

Title: import the tables
display all customers
Description:
Open the psql terminal. 
At the prompt (#) type: \connect exercisedb
This connects you to the database so you can run the commands. 
Write an sql query to find and display (Retrieve)  all the customers. Review the output table column headings, those are your data field names.

Description: Write a sql query to retrieve the first 5 customers.
